results.title: Eternal Youth
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Beyond 2000”.
Everybody wants it, and many have searched for it. “Beyond 2000” explores the growth of the life prolonging industry and the study of gerontology. It’s a penetrating look at a topic dear to each and everyone of us - life!
results.description:

results.title: King Lear (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Miller, Shaun Sutton and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
This production of Shakespeare’s great play features Michael Hordern as King Lear, Michael Kitchen as Edmund, and Frank Middlemass as the Fool. “King Lear” is a tragedy that repeatedly portrays the restless intolerance of the young towards the old, the powerlessness of virtue in the face of deceit, and the fragility of the bonds which hold families and communities together. The production features an excellent Shakespearian cast.

results.title: Twelfth Night (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Gorrie, Cedric Messina and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Felicity Kendall as Viola, this is a production of Shakespeare’s comedy of magic, romantic deception and foolish love. The film features a talented cast and remains faithful to the original text.

results.title: Junkie's ruminations
results.creator_credit: Kylie O'Brien and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Kylie O’Brien feels society has reviled drug users. She provides an insight to the world through her eyes, as well as through her art and music.

results.title: Homage to the herbster
results.creator_credit: Leo Kane and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Sometimes he inscribes his name in wet cement. As long as he spells it correctly, I’ll let it ride. A simple tale of an intense relationship between a Big Issue vendor and his terrier, his partner in both work and life.

results.title: Dear mother
results.creator_credit: Judith Mahfoud and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Life wasn’t meant to be easy, but it still can be profoundly beautiful. Judith delves into the childhood of her mother, to try to understand her better so she can pass this knowledge to her five sons and to honour the life of her mother, who grew up feeling like she was nobody’s child.

results.title: Best of British: Jaguar
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cox and Synchro Sports Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Best of British”.
An early Jaguar advertising slogan summed up the timeless appeal of this great British marque as ‘grace, space and pace’. This documentary explores these legendary qualities by taking a close look at all the significant Jaguar models, from the pre-war coach-built ‘special saloons’ through the SS100 and XK120, the E-type and XJ models, up to Britain’s first ‘supercar’- the XJ220. Interviews with Jaguar drivers such as Stirling Moss and Jack Fairman, and archival footage contribute to a fascinating review of Jaguar’s unique place in British motoring history.

results.title: Best of British: Bentley
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cox and Synchro Sports Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Best of British”.
In the twenties Bentley sports cars built up an enviable reputation for speed and reliability, with wins at Brooklands and record-breaking success at Le Mans. More than 75 years after its conception in 1919 Bentley’s original reputation for quality engineering and ‘luxury with sporting character’ is still intact. Using extensive archival footage, the program documents the early designs of W.O Bentley, the Bower Bentley’s and the Bentley 6. Also featured are interviews with Bentley collectors and a liberally illustrated history of the Bentley’s racing career.
